meanings.definition: The action or process of regenerating or being regenerated.
meanings.sent1: After the fire, the forest began its regeneration, with new trees sprouting up.
meanings.sent2: The regeneration of the lizard's tail amazed the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power of regeneration made him the star of the show.
meanings.sent4: The city's regeneration project breathed new life into the old neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The regeneration of the starfish's lost arm was a fascinating sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The renewal or restoration of a body, bodily part, or biological system after injury or as a normal process.
meanings.sent1: The regeneration of the skin cells helped heal the wound.
meanings.sent2: The regeneration of the muscle tissue was crucial for the athlete's recovery.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the rapid regeneration of a torn paper.
meanings.sent4: The regeneration of the forest after the storm was a testament to nature's resilience.
meanings.sent5: The regeneration of the starfish's lost arm was a fascinating sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The process of forming new animal or plant tissue.
meanings.sent1: The regeneration of the plant's leaves was a sign of its health.
meanings.sent2: The regeneration of the coral reef was a slow but steady process.
meanings.sent3: The farmer marveled at the regeneration of the crop after the rain.
meanings.sent4: The regeneration of the tree's branches brought new life to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The regeneration of the starfish's lost arm was a fascinating sight to behold.
